yoruba_text: □ Iriri miiran ti ó fi ọgbọn jijẹrii lọna à ìjẹ́-bí-à ṣà han wá lati Kampala, Uganda.
english_text: □ Another experience that shows the wisdom of informal witnessing comes from Kampala, Uganda.

yoruba_text: Mo ti rí ìjọ ilú mi, tí ó ti gbèrú, tí a sì pín ní ẹ̀ẹ̀mẹrin, tí ó rán à wọn akéde à ti à wọn aṣá ájú ọ̀nà já de, à wọn kan gẹ́gẹ́ bí míṣọ́nná rì lọ sí à wọn orílẹ̀ èdè tí ó jìnnà sí ara wọ́n bí Bolivia, Laos, à tiUganda.
english_text: I have seen my home congregation grow and divide four times, sending out publishers and pioneers, some as missionaries to countries as far apart as Bolivia, Laos, and Uganda.

yoruba_text: Nǹkan bí ogún ọdún sẹ́yìn ni à lùf áà yìí yè bọ́ nínú ogun gbígbóná janjan tí wọ́n gbé dìde sí ṣọ́ọ̀ṣì rẹ̀ níUganda.
english_text: Some 20 years ago, he survived the violent purges of his church in Uganda.

yoruba_text: Nínú kòtò ìhà ìwọ̀ oòrùn, à wọn à sokọ́ra òkè ń láń lá ayọná yèéfín kóra jọ, wọ́n sì di à wọn à farakọ́ra òkè ń lá Ruwenzori à ti Virunga tí ó wà gá tagàta ní à wọn ẹnu à à là Rwanda, Zaire, à tiUganda.
english_text: In the western rift, volcanic movement has formed the Ruwenzori and Virunga mountain ranges that straddle the borders of Rwanda, Zaire, and Uganda.

yoruba_text: (Iṣe 15:30-32) Ìsà lẹ̀: Alá bòójútó à yíká ń bá ìjọ kan sọ̀rọ̀ lórílẹ̀-èdèUganda.
english_text: (Acts 15:30-32) Bottom: A circuit overseer speaks to a congregation in Uganda.

yoruba_text: Iye yii ko kan awọn wọnni ti a pa ninu diẹ lara awọn ogun atajẹsilẹ julọ ti o ṣẹṣẹ wa si opin ni ọdun ti o ṣaaju, iru bii tiUganda, Afghanistan, ati Iran oun Iraq.
english_text: This figure excludes those killed in some of the bloodiest wars that had just come to a halt in the previous year, such as those in Uganda, Afghanistan, and Iran-Iraq.

yoruba_text: Ọ̀ọ́dúnrún mìíràn ń gbé inú igbó dídí ilẹ̀Ugandatí kò ṣeé wọ̀.
english_text: Another 300 dwell in the impenetrable forest in Uganda.

yoruba_text: Ipò tá a wà náà ni Brian òun Marion Wallace à tà wọn ọmọ wọn méjèèjì wa, à wọn náà sì pinnu lá ti dúró síUganda.
english_text: Brian and Marion Wallace and their two children were in a position similar to ours, and they also decided to stay in Uganda.

yoruba_text: Gbogbo nǹkan ń lọ déédéé títí di à á rọ̀ ọjọ́ kan tá a gbọ́ lórí rédíò pé ìjọba ilẹ̀Ugandati fòfin de à wa Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà.
english_text: Conditions remained calm until one morning when we heard on the radio that the Ugandagovernment had banned Jehovah's Witnesses.

yoruba_text: Ọdún 1937 ni wọ́n kọ́kọ́ mọ kòkòrò à rùn tó ń jẹ́ West Nile, ní orílẹ̀-èdèUganda, ẹ̀fọn ló sì sá bà ń kó o ran à wọn èèyàn. Lẹ́yìn èyí ni wọ́n tún ṣà kí yèsí rẹ̀ ní Àá rín Gbùngbùn Ìlà Oòrùn ayé, ilẹ̀ Éṣíà, à gbègbè Oceania, à ti ilẹ̀ Yúróòpù.
english_text: West Nile virus, transmitted to man primarily by mosquitoes, was first isolated in 1937 in Ugandaand later observed in the Middle East, Asia, Oceania, and Europe.

yoruba_text: Kò pẹ́ tí Knut à ti Lisbeth fi rí i pé à wọn ti wà ní sẹpẹ́ lá ti lọ sìn ní ilẹ̀ òkèèrè. Torí náà, wọ́n lọ sí orílẹ̀-èdèUganda.
english_text: Before long, Knut and Lisbeth felt ready to make the move, and a big one at that —to Uganda.

yoruba_text: Abẹ́ à wọn igi máń gòrò kan tó ní ibòji dá ad áa ni ìjọ kékeré kan tó wà ní à ríwáUgandati ń ṣèpà dé tẹ́lẹ̀.
english_text: A small congregation in northern Ugandaused to hold meetings under some densely leaved mango trees.

yoruba_text: Lá sìkò tá a fẹ́ ṣe à péjọ yẹn, póòpù ń bọ̀ wá sí orílẹ̀-èdèUganda, à wọn èèyàn sì ń múra sílẹ̀ dè é.
english_text: At the time, people were preparing for the pope's visit.

yoruba_text: Kò pẹ́ lẹ́yìn náà ni mo sì bẹ̀rẹ̀ iṣẹ́ ní Pá pákọ̀ Òfuurufú Ńlá ti Entebbe lórílẹ̀-èdèUganda, níbi tá a ti lo ọdún mẹ́rin à ti oṣù méje.
english_text: Not long thereafter, I received employment at Entebbe International Airport, in Uganda, where we would stay for four years and seven months.

yoruba_text: Nígbà tá a wà ní orílẹ̀-èdèUganda, ẹ̀ẹ̀mejì ni rògbòdìyàn ń lá bẹ́ sílẹ̀, à mọ́ èyí kò dá à wọn ìgbòkègbodò tẹ̀mí wa dúró rá rá.
english_text: Civil unrest broke out twice in Ugandawhile we were there, but that did not bring our spiritual activities to a halt.

yoruba_text: Àwa tá a kù níUgandasì ń ṣe à wọn ìpà dé ìjọ nìṣó, bẹ́ẹ̀ la sì ń bá iṣẹ́ ìwà ásù wa lọ, bó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé ọgbọ́n la fi ń ṣe é.
english_text: Those of us left in Ugandakept on with our Christian meetings and the preaching work, although we had to be prudent and cautious.

yoruba_text: Àmọ́ ọ̀pọ̀ rẹpẹtẹ èèyàn tó ti sá wá síUgandaníto rí ogun tí wọ́n ń jà lá wọn orílẹ̀-èdè tó wà lá gbègbè ibẹ̀ ń fẹ́ à fiyèsí ní ká njúk ánjú.
english_text: However, an urgent concern is the large number of refugees who have streamed into Uganda.

yoruba_text: Lẹ́yìn tí mo sìn níUgandafún sáà kan, mo dé Dar es Salaam, tí í ṣe olú ìlú Tanganyika, níbẹ̀rẹ̀ ọdún 1956.
english_text: After serving in Ugandafor some time, I arrived early in 1956 in Dar es Salaam, the capital of Tanganyika.

yoruba_text: Lá ti fi hàn bí ilẹ̀Ugandaṣe lọ́ràá tó, wọ́n máa ń pa á lá ṣamọ̀ níbẹ̀ pé tó o bá ti igi lá sán bọ ilẹ̀Ugandalá lẹ́, tó bá fi máa dà árọ̀ yóò ti ta gbòǹgbò.
english_text: It has been said that if you drive a stick into the fertile soil of Ugandain the evening, it will have roots in the morning.

yoruba_text: Lọ́dún 1971, ogun abẹ́lé tó ṣẹlẹ̀ kò jẹ́ ká ní ìfọ̀kà nbalẹ̀ mọ́ níUganda.
english_text: In 1971 civil war shattered our peace in Uganda.

yoruba_text: NíUganda, Stanley à ti Esinala Makumba jẹ́ orísun ìṣírí fún ìdílé wa
english_text: In Uganda, Stanley and Esinala Makumba were a source of encouragement to our family

yoruba_text: A dúpẹ́ lọ́wọ́ Jèhófà Ọlọ́run pé ó ṣì fà yè sílẹ̀ kí púpọ̀ sí i lá ra à wọn èèyàn onírúurú ẹ̀yà tó wà níUgandalè gbọ́ nípa Ìjọba rẹ̀.
english_text: We thank Jehovah God for allowing time for yet more of Uganda'sdiverse people to learn about his Kingdom.

yoruba_text: Nígbà tí ìwé ìròyìn Africa News ti June 22, 2006, ń ṣà làyé nípa “à pérò kan tó dá lórí ìṣekúṣe à ti wíwo à wọn ohun tó ń mú ọkàn èèyàn fà sí ìṣekúṣe,” èyí tó máa ń wá yé lá wọn ilé jẹ́gẹjẹ̀gẹ tí wọ́n kọ́ sapá ibì kan bá yìí lórílẹ̀-èdèUganda, ó sọ pé “pípa tá wọn òbí pa à wọn ọmọ wọn tì ló mú kí iṣẹ́ aṣẹ́wó à ti lílo oògùn olóró pọ̀ sí i lá dùúgbò náà.”
english_text: Africa News of June 22, 2006, reporting on a “workshop on sexual abuse and pornography” in slums in one part of Uganda, said it is the “parent's neglect that has increased prostitution and drug abuse in the area.”

yoruba_text: Nígbà tí iṣẹ́ kí kọ́ Gbọ̀ngàn Ìjọba kan ń lọ lọ́wọ́ lá pá gúúsù ìlà oòrùnUganda, bíríkìlà kan lá dùúgbò ibẹ̀ rí ẹ̀mí ìfẹ́, ìfọwọ́sowọ́pọ̀ à ti ìwà-bí-ọ̀rẹ́ tó wà lá àárín à wọn ará, èyí sì wú u lórí débi pé ó wá bá wọn ṣiṣẹ́ níbẹ̀ lọ́fẹ̀ẹ́.
english_text: At a Kingdom Hall building project in the southeastern part of the country, a local mason was so moved by the spirit of friendliness, love, and cooperation he observed among the brothers that he volunteered to help with the work.

yoruba_text: Orílẹ̀-ède India ni wọ́n bí bà bá mi sí, ọmọ ilẹ̀ India ni ìyá mi náà, à mọ́ orílẹ̀-èdèUgandaní wọ́n bí wọn sí.
english_text: My father was born in India, and my mother, although of Indian origin, was born in Uganda.

yoruba_text: Uganda
english_text: Uganda

yoruba_text: Ukréìn
english_text: Ukraine

yoruba_text: ukréìn
english_text: ukraine

yoruba_text: ulan bator
english_text: ulan bator

yoruba_text: Umaru Musa Yar’Adua
english_text: Ballymote

yoruba_text: Umaru Musa Yar’Adua
english_text: Umaru Yar'Adua

yoruba_text: Umuahia
english_text: Umuahia

yoruba_text: Ìròyìn kan tí Àjọ Àkà nlò Owó Ti Ìparapọ̀ Àwọn Orílẹ̀-Èdè fún Àwọn Ọmọdé (UNICEF) ṣe fi hàn pé, ní à wọn orílẹ̀-èdè kan, iye ọmọkùnrin tí a ń mú lọ gbà tọ́jú nílé ìwòsàn jẹ́ ìlọ́po méjì ti ọmọbìnrin.
english_text: In some countries twice as many boys as girls are brought to health centers, explains a report from the United Nations Children's Fund(UNICEF).

yoruba_text: Àjọ Tí Ń Bójú Tó Àkà nlò Owó Tí Ìparapọ̀ Orílẹ̀-èdè Fún Àwọn Ọmọdé (UNICEF) sọ pé, bí obìnrin náà “ṣe tara ṣà ṣà wá nǹkan ṣe, tí ọmọ rẹ̀ sì gba ìtọ́jú tó yẹ, ló jẹ́ kí ara ọmọ náà tètè yá.”
english_text: According to UNICEF, because of her “quick response and access to community health care, her child's illness was cut short.”

yoruba_text: Nígbà tí ìwé ìròyìn Manchester Guardian Weekly ti ilẹ̀ Gẹ̀ẹ́sì ń ṣà yọlò ìsọfúnni tí Àjọ Tí Ń Bójú Tó Àkà nlò Owó Tí Ìparapọ̀ Àwọn Orílẹ̀-Èdè fún Àwọn Ọmọdé (UNICEF), gbé já de ní òpin ọdún 1995, ó sọ pé: “Nínú à wọn ogun tó jà ní ẹ̀wá dún tó kọjá, mílíọ̀nù méjì à wọn ọmọdé ló kú, mílíọ̀nù mẹ́rin sí má rùn-ún ló di alá àbọ̀ ara, mílíọ̀nù méjìlá ni kò rílé gbé, à wọn tó lé ní mílíọ̀nù kan ló di ọmọ òrukàn tà bí tí wọ́n yà nípa kúrò lọ́dọ̀ à wọn òbí wọn, à wọn mílíọ̀nù mẹ́wàá ni à ròdùn ti dà lórí rú.”
english_text: Citing information provided by the United Nations Children's Fund(UNICEF), at the end of 1995, England's Manchester Guardian Weekly stated: “In the wars of the past decade, 2 million children have been killed, 4-5 million disabled, 12 million made homeless, more than 1 million orphaned or separated from their parents and 10 million psychologically traumatised.”

yoruba_text: Ìròyìn tó wá lá ti ọ̀dọ̀ Àjọ Àkà nlò Owó Ti Ìparapọ̀ Àwọn Orílẹ̀-Èdè fún Àwọn Ọmọdé (UNICEF) sọ pé: “Ní ọdún mẹ́wàá sẹ́yìn, ó lé ní mílíọ̀nù méjì ọmọdé tó gun pa, ó sì lé ní mílíọ̀nù mẹ́rin tí a sọ di alá àbọ̀ ara, bá kan náà ni ogun ti sọ à wọn tó lé ní mílíọ̀nù kan di alá ìlóbìí tà bí kí wọ́n máà rí à wọn ìdílé wọn mọ́.”
english_text: A report from the United Nations Children's Fund(UNICEF) said: “In the last decade, more than 2 million children have been killed during wars, while more than 4 million have survived physical mutilation and more than 1 million have been orphaned or separated from their families as a result of war.”

yoruba_text: Ìròyìn Àjọ Àkà nlò Owó Ti Ìparapọ̀ Àwọn Orílẹ̀-Èdè fún Àwọn Ọmọdé (UNICEF) sọ ní ọdún 1992 pé, “'gbígbé ogun dìde sí à wọn ọmọdé' jẹ́ ìhùmọ̀ ọ̀rúndún ogún.”
english_text: In 1992 a United Nations Children's Fund(UNICEF) report said that “'war on children' is a 20th century invention.”

yoruba_text: Ìwé ìròyìn kan ní Gúúsù Áfíríkà tí wọ́n ń pè ní Sowetan fa ọ̀rọ̀ yọ lá tinú ìròyìn kan tí Àjọ Tí Ń Bójú Tó Àkà nlò Owó ti Ìparapọ̀ Àwọn Orílẹ̀-Èdè fún Àwọn Ọmọdé (UNICEF) gbé já de níbi ìpà dé à pérò ọ̀hún, ó sọ pé: “Ìwá dìí tí à jọUNICEFṣe fi hàn pé ìpín mọ́kà nléláà ádọ́ta nínú ọgọ́rùn-ún à wọn ọ̀dọ́bìnrin, tọ́jọ́ orí wọn jẹ́ mẹ́ẹ̀ẹ́dógún sí mọ́kà ndínlógún ní Gúúsù Áfíríkà ni kò mọ̀ pé ẹnì kan tá ra rẹ̀ jọ pé ó le dá ad áa lè ti kó kòkòrò à rùn éèdì, à ti pé ó lè tà taré rẹ̀ sí wọn.”
english_text: The South African newspaper Sowetan commented on a report that was released at the conference by the United Nations Children's Fund(UNICEF): “Unicef's surveys found that 51 percent of girls aged 15 to 19 in South Africa did not know that someone who looks healthy can be infected with HIV and transmit it to them.”

yoruba_text: Àní sẹ́, Àjọ Tí Ń Bójú Tó Àkà nlò Owó Ti Ìparapọ̀ Orílẹ̀-Èdè fún Àwọn Ọmọdé (UNICEF) ròyìn pé nǹkan bí ẹgbẹ̀rún mẹ́rin ọmọdé ló ń kú lọ́dọọdún níto rí ewu à wọn oúnjẹ míì tá wọn èèyàn fi ń rọ́pò ọmú ìyá.
english_text: In fact, the United Nations Children's Fund(UNICEF) reports that some 4,000 children die every day as a result of hazards associated with breast-milk substitutes.

yoruba_text: Nípa bẹ́ẹ̀, ó ti lé ní à á dọ́ta ọdún bá yìí tí à jọUNICEFti ń pèsè oúnjẹ, aṣọ, à ti ìtọ́jú lọ́nà ti ìṣègùn fún à wọn ọmọdé já kèj ádò ayé, wọ́n sì ti ń gbìyà njú lá ti bójú tó ohun tí à wọn ọmọdé ṣalá ìní lá papọ̀.
english_text: Thus, for over half a century, UNICEFhas been providing children throughout the world with food, clothing, and medical care and has been trying to look after children's needs in general.

yoruba_text: Gẹgẹ biUNICEF(Ajọ Owó Akanlo Iparapọ Orilẹ-ede fun Awọn Ọmọde) ti wí, iyẹn ni iye bibanininujẹ ninu awọn ọmọde ti wọn kò tii pe ọdun marun-un ti wọn ń kú lọdọọdun fun à ìjẹunre-ká nú ati awọn aisan ti ó rọrun lati dènà ni awọn ilẹ ti ó ṣẹṣẹ ń goke à gbà.
english_text: According to UNICEF (United Nations Children's Fund), that is the appalling number of children under five who die of malnutrition and easily preventable diseases each year in developing lands.

yoruba_text: ÀjọUNICEFṣèṣirò pé à á dọ́ta ọ̀kẹ́ ọmọdé tí ń kú lọ́dọọdún ni a ti lè gbà là bí à wọn ìyá bá ń fi ọmú bọ́ ọmọ fún oṣù mẹ́rin sí mẹ́fà à kọ́kọ́ nínú ìgbésí ayé à wọn ọmọ náà.
english_text: UNICEFcalculates that a million child deaths each year could be avoided if mothers were to breast-feed babies for the first four to six months of their lives.

yoruba_text: Àwọn ilé iṣẹ́ tó ń rí sí ọ̀ràn gbígba ọmọ ẹlòmíràn ṣọmọ, à wọn ilé ìtọ́jú à wọn ọmọ òrukàn, Ibùdó Ìgbà là fún Àwọn Ọmọdé, à jọUNICEF, à ti à wọn à jọ à ti ẹgbẹ́ tó dà bíi wọn ṣe dá ad áa nípa gbígbìyà njú lá ti ṣèrà nwọ́ fún à wọn ọmọ tí òṣì ń ta.
english_text: Adoption agencies, orphanages, SOS Children's Villages, UNICEF, and similar organizations or groups serve a good purpose when they try to provide support to underprivileged children.

yoruba_text: Gẹ́gẹ́ bí ìròyìn kan tí ÀjọUNICEFgbé já de ní ọdún 1996, ojú ìwòye à wọn kan ni pé 'ìran à wọn ọ̀tá ọjọ́ iwá jú, tí í ṣe à wọn ọmọ tí à wọn ọ̀tá bí pà ápàá ni a gbọ́dọ̀ mú kúrò.'
english_text: According to a 1996 report by UNICEF, the view of some is that 'future generations of the enemy, that is, the enemies' children, must also be eliminated.'

yoruba_text: ÀjọUNICEFparí ọ̀rọ̀ pé: “Níto rí náà, bá wọn èèyàn bá ṣe kà wé tó ló ń pinnu bí à wọn ọmọdé ṣe ń kú tó ní orílẹ̀-èdè Benin à ti níbi gbogbo lá gbàá yé.”
english_text: UNICEFconcludes: “The level of education is hence a determining factor in the infant mortality rate in Benin, as it is all over the world.”

yoruba_text: Lá ti ṣà pèjúwe kókó wọn, à jọUNICEFfúnni ní à wọn kókó oníṣirò wọ̀nyí: Àfikún ìná wó tí a fojú bù lá ti ká jú à ìní ká rí ayé fún ìjẹunreká nú à ti ìtọ́jú ìlera ìpìlẹ̀ púpọ̀ tó jẹ́ bílíọ̀nù 13 dọ́là lọ́dún; fún ẹ̀kọ́ alá kọ̀ọ́bẹ̀rẹ̀, bílíọ̀nù 6 dọ́là; fún fífa omi dá rad ára à ti ìmọ́tó tó, bílíọ̀nù 9 dọ́là; fún ìfètò-sọ́mọ-bíbí, bílíọ̀nù 6 dọ́là—ó jẹ́ à ròpọ̀ bílíọ̀nù 34 dọ́là lọ́dún.
english_text: To illustrate their point, UNICEFgives the following figures: The estimated extra cost of meeting the worldwide need for adequate nutrition and basic health care is $13 billion a year; for primary education, $6 billion; for safe water and sanitation, $9 billion; for family planning, $6 billion—making a total of $34 billion a year.

yoruba_text: ÀjọUNICEFwá pà rọwà pé ká wọn èèyàn fọwọ́ gidi mú ọ̀rọ̀ “à wọn ohun ìdá àbòbò tó jíire, à wọn nǹkan bí: à ṣíborí, dídín eré sísá ọkọ̀ ìrìnnà kù lá wọn à gbègbè téèyàn bá wà, à wọn ìjókòó tó ń dá àbò bo ọmọdé nínú ọkọ̀ ìrìnnà, bẹ́líìtì à à bò nínú ọkọ̀ ìrìnnà, à wọn ìdérí agolo oògùn tọ́mọdé kò ní lè ṣí, ká wọn ẹ̀rọ tó ń kófìrí èéfín máa wà nínú ilé, à ti pé kí ibi ìṣeré jẹ́ èyí tó lá àbò.”
english_text: UNICEFurged that attention be given to “proven life-savers: helmets, speed limits in heavily populated areas, child-safety seats in cars, seat belts, child-safety caps on medicine, smoke detectors in homes, and playground safety standards.”

yoruba_text: Bí ó ti wù kí ó rí, “gẹ́gẹ́ bí iye tí à jọ WHO [Àjọ Ìlera Àgbá yé] gbe já de kẹ́yìn ṣe fi hàn, nǹkan bí ìlọ́po mẹ́rin iye à wọn ọ̀dọ́bìnrin tí ń pa ara wọn ni iye à wọn ọ̀dọ́kùnrin tí ń pa ara wọn.”—The Progress of Nations, tí ÀjọUNICEFgbé já de.
english_text: However, “about four times as many young males as females commit suicide in the industrialized nations according to the latest figures from WHO [World Health Organization].”—The Progress of Nations, published by UNICEF.

yoruba_text: Ìwá dìí kúlẹ̀kúlẹ̀ kan, tí à jọUNICEF(Àjọ Àkà nlò Owó Ti Ìparapọ̀ Àwọn Orílẹ̀-Èdè fún Àwọn Ọmọdé) ṣe, fi hàn pé nǹkan bí 585,000 obìnrin ní ń kú lọ́dọọdún nígbà tí wọ́n lóyún à tí nígbà tí wọ́n ń bímọ.
english_text: About 585,000 women die each year during pregnancy or while giving birth, says a new comprehensive survey by UNICEF (United Nations Children's Fund).

yoruba_text: Ìtẹ̀já de The State of the World's Children 1995, ìròyìn kan tí à jọUNICEF(Àjọ Àkà nlò Owó Ti Ìparapọ̀ Àwọn Orílẹ̀-Èdè fún Àwọn Ọmọdé) ṣe, sọ pé kò bọ́gbọ́n mu lá ti ronú pé à gbá yé kò lè ká jú à wọn kòṣeémá nìí ṣíṣe kókó tí à wọn ọmọdé nílò.
english_text: The State of the World's Children1995, a report by UNICEF (United Nations Children's Fund), says that it is absurd to think that the world cannot afford to meet the essential needs of its children.

yoruba_text: Ó dùn wá lá ti sọ pé ìròyìn kan tí à jọUNICEFgbé já de fi hàn pé ọwọ́ ìyà ò tán lá ra à wọn ọmọdé ní à wọn orílẹ̀-èdè tí wọ́n ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ ń gòkè à gbà lá àárín Ọdún Àwọn Ọmọdé ní Àgbá yé.
english_text: Sad to say, according to a UNICEFreport, children in developing nations did not fare well during the International Year of the Child.

yoruba_text: Àwọn à bá jáde ìwá dìí wọ̀nyí, tó jẹ́ apá kan ìwá dìí ọdọọdún ti Progress of Nations, tí à jọUNICEF(Àjọ Àkà nlò Owó Ti Ìparapọ̀ Àwọn Orílẹ̀-Èdè fún Àwọn Ọmọdé) ṣètò rẹ̀, tún fi hàn pé, “à wọn à kọsílẹ̀ oníṣirò nípa ìmọ́tó tó wà lá ra à wọn tí ń burú sí i lá gbàá yé, wọn kò sunwọ̀n sí i.”
english_text: These findings, part of the Progress of Nationsannual survey conducted by UNICEF (United Nations Children's Fund), also reveal that “sanitation statistics are among those getting worse worldwide, not better.”

yoruba_text: ÀjọUNICEFsọ pé lójoojúmọ́, nǹkan bí ọgọ́rùn-ún má rùn-ún sí méje à wọn ìkókó ló ń kó fá írọ́ọ̀sì tó ń pa agbá ra ìdènà à rùn lá tinú wà rà ìyá wọn.
english_text: According to UNICEF, about 500 to 700 infants per day are infected by the breast milk of their HIV-positive mothers.

yoruba_text: ÀjọUNICEFalá ra jẹ́wọ́ ní oṣù November 1999 pe, “à wọn ṣì ní ohun púpọ̀ lá ti ṣe,” ó sì ṣà làyé pé: “Já kèj ádò ayé, nǹkan bí à wọn ọmọdé tí iye wọ́n tó mílíọ̀nù méjìlá, tí wọn kò tíì pé ọmọ ọdún má rùn-ún ló ń kú lọ́dọọdún, à wọn ohun tí a lè dènà rẹ̀ ló sì ń pa èyí tó pọ̀ jù lọ lá ra wọn.
english_text: Admitting in November 1999 that “much remains to be done,”UNICEFexplained: “Globally, an estimated 12 million children under the age of five die every year, mostly of easily preventable causes.

yoruba_text: Lá ìpẹ́ yìí, à jọUNICEFsọ pé: “Àdéhùn náà ti yá ra di à déhùn lórí ẹ̀tọ́ ọmọnìyàn tó ṣètẹ́wọ́gbà jù lọ, ó sì ń fún à wọn ọmọdé já kèj ádò ayé ní ìṣírí.”
english_text: “The Convention,”UNICEFrecently noted, “has rapidly become the most widely accepted human rights treaty ever, creating a global momentum for children.”

yoruba_text: ÀjọUNICEFwá sọ pé, lá ìka ìtọ́ni yìí sí, à wọn kan ṣì ń ṣi à wọn èèyàn lọ́nà nípa pípolówó pé “kò sí ìyà tọ̀ lá àárín oúnjẹ ọmọ tí wọ́n ṣe sínú agolo à ti ọmú.”
english_text: Despite this recommendation, the UNICEFRegional Nutrition Adviser for Eastern and Southern Africa stated that false advertising persists in claiming that “infant formula is as good as breast milk.”

yoruba_text: Nígbà tí ìwé ìròyìn Indian Express ń sọ̀rọ̀ lórí ìròyìn à jọUNICEFnáà, ọ̀rọ̀ olóòtú inú rẹ̀ kédà árò pé ń ṣe ni Ọdún Àwọn Ọmọdé wá yọrí sí “ọ̀rọ̀ à pá rá tí ń pani lẹ́kún.”
english_text: Commenting on the UNICEFreport, an editorial in the Indian Express newspaper complained that the Year of the Child turned out to be a “cruel joke.”

yoruba_text: Ó jẹ́ iyọrisi yíyí ki ki ìdá kekere kan ninu itanṣan olóróuraniumati afẹfẹ hydrogen pada si agbara ti o parapọ jẹ́ kìmí inu bọmbu naa.
english_text: It was the result of changing into energy just a small fraction of theuraniumand hydrogen that made up the core of the bomb.

yoruba_text: Ki a sọ pe wọn lè kó gbogbo agbara oníná yẹn jọpọ ki wọn sì yí i si iwọnba ìtà nṣ án olóróuraniumati afẹfeẹ hydrogen diẹ.
english_text: Suppose they could capture all that fiery energy and convert it into a few pounds ofuraniumand hydrogen.

yoruba_text: Gbogbo ohun tí wọ́n nílò kò ju kí wọ́n ṣáà ti ní ìwọ̀nba èròjà uraniumtàbí èròjà pluto nium tí wọ́n lè fọ́ sí wẹ́wẹ́.
english_text: All that is needed is the acquisition of a sufficient amount of fissileuraniumor plutonium.

yoruba_text: Ní ọ̀sẹ̀ kan lẹ́yìn náà, à wọn onífà yàwọ́ méje ni a mú ní Munich tí a sì bá òkútauraniumtí ìwọ̀n rẹ̀ tó 2.2 kìlógírá àmù lọ́wọ́ wọn.
english_text: A week later, seven smugglers were caught in Munich with 4.9 pounds [2.2 kg] ofuranium.

yoruba_text: Ohùn tí ó tuni lá ra, sísọ̀rọ̀ wúyẹ́wúyẹ́ sí Ọlọrun nínú à dúrà, ẹni tí ó lè gbọ́ ohunkóhun lá ti ibikí bi—à ní wọ́n tilẹ̀ gbìyà njú kí kọrin lá ti inú à wọn à gbá uraniumtí ó ti gbó, tí ó sì ti dógùn-ún.
english_text: Soft sounds, a whispered prayer to God, who can hear anything from anywhere—even attempted singing from the inside of old, rustyuraniumbarrels.

yoruba_text: Bó tilẹ̀ jẹ́ pé ọ̀rọ̀ à ṣírí tí a pa mọ́ dá ad áa ni wọ́n fi ọ̀ràn iye tó jẹ́ gan-an ṣe, a fojú díwọ̀n pé a nílò nǹkan bíi kìlógírá àmù mẹ́ta sí mẹ́ẹ̀ẹ́dọ́gbọ̀n èròjà uraniumtí a ṣiṣẹ́ lé lórí tà bí bíi kìlógírá àmù kan sí mẹ́jọ èròjà pluto nium tó jẹ́ ìsọ̀rí èyí tí wọ́n fi ń ṣe ohun ìjà lá ti ṣe bọ́ǹbù ọ̀gbá lẹ̀gbá ràwé kan.
english_text: Although the exact amount is a well-kept secret, it is estimated that a nuclear bomb requires between 6 and 50 pounds [3-25 kg] of enricheduraniumor between 2 and 20 pounds [1-8 kg] of weapons-grade plutonium.

yoruba_text: Ìwé ìròyìn yẹn sọ pé: “Ó rọrùn fá wọn apá nil áyà tó bá ní èròjà uraniumtí wọ́n lè fi ṣe ohun ìjà olóró lá ti ṣe ohun ìjà abúgbàù, kìkì ohun tí wọ́n nílò lá ti ṣe kò ju pé kí wọ́n ṣáà ti da ìdajì kan pọ̀ mọ́ ìdajì mìíràn.”
english_text: The magazine states: “Terrorists possessing modern weapons-gradeuraniumwould have a good chance of setting off an explosion simply by dropping one half of it onto the other half.”

yoruba_text: Bí a tilẹ̀ fi wọ́n sẹ́wọ̀n, wọ́n kọ̀ lá ti wauraniumfún ète ogun.
english_text: Though imprisoned, they refused to mineuraniumfor war purposes.

yoruba_text: Lá ti à wọn ọ̀rúndún wọ̀nyí wá ni ṣọ́ọ̀ṣì à wọn Ọmọlẹ́yìn Waldo ti fìdí múlẹ̀ lá wọn orílẹ̀-èdè tó jìnnà gan-an sí ilẹ̀ Faransé bíUruguayà ti Orílẹ̀-Èdè Amẹ́ríkà.
english_text: Over the centuries, Waldensian churches have been established in countries as far away from France as Uruguayand the United States.

yoruba_text: Iṣẹ́ à gbègbè wa gbé wa dé à à là ilẹ̀ à wọn aráUruguayní gúúsù, Paraguay ní ìwọ̀-oòrùn, ìpínlẹ̀ Pernambuco ní à ríwá, à ti Òkun Atlantic ní ìhà ìlà-oòrun Brazil.
english_text: Our district took us to the Uruguayanborder on the south, Paraguay on the west, the state of Pernambuco in the north, and the Atlantic Ocean on the eastern side of Brazil.

yoruba_text: Atamá tàsé agbá bọ́ọ̀lù ọwọ́ iwá jú fúnUruguay, Luiz Suarez ló gbá à mì-ayò kí nní wọlé nísè̩ẹ́jú mẹ́wàá sáà à kọ́kọ́ tí ìfẹsẹ̀wọnsẹ̀ náà bẹ̀rẹ̀ lá ti mukò̩ ò̩hún darí.
english_text: Luiz Suarez gave Uruguaya 10th minute lead with a sublime free kick that beat the Russian wall to give the South Americans the lead.

yoruba_text: Nígbẹ̀yìngbẹ́yín, ọkọ̀ ojú omi ayá ra-bí-à ṣá mẹ́ta tí ó jẹ́ ti ilẹ̀ Britain dá Graf Spee lọ́nà, wọ́n sì kọ lù ú, èyí tí ó yọrí sí òfò ẹ̀mí à ti fífipá mú ọkọ̀ ojú omi náà lá ti forí lé èbútéUruguayti Montevideo fún à túnṣe.
english_text: Finally, three British cruisers tracked down and attacked the Graf Spee, causing loss of life and forcing the ship to limp into the Uruguayanharbor of Montevideo for repairs.

yoruba_text: ÌjọbaUruguaypà ṣẹ kí ọkọ̀ ogun ojú omi náà padà sí orí òkun kíá mọ́sá, à ìjẹ́ bẹ́ẹ̀ òun kì yóò jẹ́ kí ó lọ mọ́.
english_text: The Uruguayangovernment ordered the battleship back to sea immediately, otherwise it would be interned.

yoruba_text: Adùn ìdíje à gbá yé fún Russia forís̩á npó̩n ló̩jó̩ ajé bíUruguays̩e fà gbà han ikọ̀ náà pẹ̀lú 3-0.
english_text: Russia's World Cup honeymoon feel came crashing down on Monday as they were pounded 3-0 by Uruguay.

yoruba_text: Àwọn ará bìnrin méjì ń wà ásù fún ọkùnrin kan nínú ṣọ́ọ̀bù rẹ̀ nílùú Montevideo, olú ìlúUruguay
english_text: Two sisters share a timely message with a store owner in Montevideo, capital of Uruguay

yoruba_text: Uruguaylé téń té group A, pẹ̀lú à mì mẹ́sàn-án láì mà wò̩n wo̩n.
english_text: Uruguaytopped group A with 9 points with no goals conceded.

yoruba_text: NíUruguay, ọkùnrin mìíràn tí orúkọ rẹ̀ ń jẹ́ Luis kò lá yọ̀ rá rá.
english_text: In Uruguay, another man named Luis was far from happy.

yoruba_text: Ẹlẹ́rìí kan tí ń ṣèbẹ̀wò lá ti ilé dé ilé níUruguayfi ìwé à ṣà rò kúkúrú sílẹ̀ fún ọkùnrin kan.
english_text: A Witness visiting from house to house in Uruguayplaced a tract with a man.

yoruba_text: Ìṣirò lọ́ọ́lọ́ọ́ ti igbó olóoru tí à ń pa run jẹ́ nǹkan bí 150,000 sí 200,000 kìlómítà níbùú lóròó lọ́dún, ó fẹ́rẹ̀ẹ́ tó bi tóUruguay.
english_text: Latest estimates put the destruction of tropical forests at between 60,000 [150,000] and 80,000 [200,000 sq km] square miles every year, about the size of Uruguay.

yoruba_text: Kristẹni kan níUruguaykọ̀wé pé: “Mo dúpẹ́ mo tún ọpẹ́ dá lọ́wọ́ Jèhófà fún inú rere à ìlẹ́tọ̀ọ́sí rẹ̀ à ti fún ìbá dọ́rẹ̀ẹ́ rẹ̀.”
english_text: A Christian in Uruguaywrites: “My heart swells with appreciation, and I am moved to thank Jehovah for his undeserved kindness and for his friendship.”

yoruba_text: Ó kọ́kọ́ sìn gẹ́gẹ́ bí míṣọ́nná rì, níUruguay, lẹ́yìn náà ní Kòlóń bíà, ó sì ń bá iṣẹ́ náà lọ bá yìí ní Puerto Rico.
english_text: She has served as a missionary first in Uruguay, then in Colombia, and now in Puerto Rico.

yoruba_text: Ọdún 1927 ni wọ́n bí mi ní orílẹ̀-èdèUruguaytó wà lá àárín orílẹ̀-èdè Ajẹntínà à ti Brazil, Olódùmarè sì fi à yíká rírẹwà tó pọ̀ gan-an jíǹkí orílẹ̀-èdè ọ̀hún ní apá Etíkun Àtìláń tíìkì.
english_text: I was born in 1927 in Uruguay, a small pear-shaped country situated between Argentina and Brazil and favored with miles of beautiful scenery along the Atlantic Coast.

yoruba_text: Ṣà gbéyẹ̀wò ohun tó ṣẹlẹ̀ sí à wọn ọ̀dọ́bìnrin méjì tí wọn kò tíì pé ọmọ ogún ọdún tí wọ́n ń gbé ní orílẹ̀-èdèUruguay.
english_text: Consider what happened to two teenage sisters in Uruguay.

yoruba_text: Ẹ̀wẹ̀, nínú ipò à tẹ tuntun ọ̀hún lá gbàá yé, orílẹ̀-èdè Germany, Brazil à ti Belguim síì dipò wọn mú ní ìtẹ̀léǹtẹ̀lé, bẹ́ẹ̀ sì ni, Russia, Poland atiUruguayláǹfà àní lá ti wà lá àrin ipò kí nní sí ogún.
english_text: While the top three positions in the world are unchanged as Germany, Brazil and Belguim sit respectively, Russia-bound duo of Poland and Uruguayhave succeeded in making strides within the top 20.

yoruba_text: Nígbà tí wọ́n gbọ́ bẹ́ẹ̀, ẹgbẹ́ à wọn ọlọ́rọ̀ oníṣòwò ní United States há yà ọkọ̀ òfuurufú kan, tí ó ná ẹnì kọ̀ọ̀kan ní 2,500 dọ́là, lá ti lọ síUruguaylá ti lọ wo ìjà tí ẹ̀jẹ̀ ti ń ṣàn náà.
english_text: Hearing of this, a party of wealthy businessmen in the United States chartered a plane, at a cost of about $2,500 a head, to fly to Uruguayto witness the gory battle.

yoruba_text: Síbẹ̀ wọ́n máa ń sọ̀rọ̀ kan ní orílẹ̀-èdèUruguaypé: “No hay mal que por bien no venga,” “Kò sí bí nǹkan ṣe lè burú tó kí à yè ọpẹ́ má wà níbẹ̀.”
english_text: Still, in Uruguaythere is a popular expression “No hay mal que por bien no venga,” “Nothing is so bad that something good cannot come from it.”

yoruba_text: November 6, 1910, ni wọ́n bí Ará kùnrin Swingle nílùú Lincoln, ní Ìpínlẹ̀ Nebraska, ṣùgbọ́n lá ìpẹ́ lẹ́yìn náà ni ìdílé wọn ṣí lọ sí Salt Lake City, ní Ìpínlẹ̀Utah.
english_text: Brother Swingle was born on November 6, 1910, in Lincoln, Nebraska, but soon afterward the family moved to Salt Lake City, Utah.

yoruba_text: Nígbà tí mo tún lọ ṣe ìwá dìí ní ibi tí à wọn ẹlẹ́sìn Mormon ń kó ohun ìṣẹ̀ǹbá yé sí ní ìpínlẹ̀Utah, mo rí i pé òótọ́ ni gbogbo ohun tí mo kà nínú ìwé ìròyìn Jí! yẹn.
english_text: It was, and those facts were further confirmed when I visited Mormon museums in Utah.

yoruba_text: Lá ti ọdún 1868 ni ìjọba United States ti pín ilẹ̀ tí a yà sọ́tọ̀ tí ó tó 62,000 kìlómítà níbùú lóròó fún à wọn ará Navajo ní à ríwá ìlà oòrùn Arizona, nítòsí ibi tí a pè ní igun mẹ́rin, níbi tí à wọn ìpínlẹ̀ mẹ́rin náà, Arizona, Colorado, New Mexico, à tiUtahti pà dé.
english_text: Since 1868 the United States government has apportioned to the Navajo some 24,000 square miles [62,000 sq km] of reservation land in northeastern Arizona, around what is called four corners, where the four states of Arizona, Colorado, New Mexico, and Utahmeet.

yoruba_text: Ìwé ìròyìn Deseret News ti ìlú Salt Lake City, ní ìpínlẹ̀Utahkí yè sí à wọn Ẹlẹ́rìí Jèhófà, ó sì sọ pé “ìdílé wọn máa ń wà pa pọ̀ bí òṣùṣù ọwọ̀, wọ́n ṣeé fọkàn tán lá wùjọ, wọ́n sì máa ń ṣiṣẹ́ ká ra.”
english_text: The Deseret News of Salt Lake City, Utah, observed that Jehovah's Witnesses “promote strong family ties and develop productive and honest citizens.”

yoruba_text: Níto rí pé bí ìwé ìròyìn “What's Up,” tí Àjọ Àwọn Aṣèwá dìí Nípa Ẹgbẹ́ Ọmọ Ìta níUtahń ṣe, ti sọ, “nígbà tí à wọn èwé bá nímọ̀lá ra pé a nífẹ̀ẹ́ à wọn, pé à wọn sì lá àbò—kì í ṣe à à bò ní ti owó, bí kò ṣe ní ti ìmọ̀lá ra—à wọn à ìní tí ó máa ń sún wọn wọ ẹgbẹ́ ọmọ ìta sá bà máa ń pòórá.”
english_text: Because as “What's Up,” a magazine published by the Utah Gang Investigators Association, said, “when youths feel loved and secure—not financially secure, but emotionally secure—the needs that drive them into gangs often vanish.”

yoruba_text: Dalung sọ̀rọ̀ ọ̀hún di mímọ̀ lá sìkò ayẹyẹ ọdún eré-ìdá rayá kejì ìpínlẹ̀ Akwa Ibom, 2nd Akwa Ibom State Youth Sports Festival tí ó wá yé lọ́jọ́ ìṣẹ́gun (Tuesday), ni olú-ìlú ìpínlẹ̀ ọ̀hún, Uyo.
english_text: Dalung made this known during the opening of the 2nd Akwa Ibom State Youth Sports Festival in Uyo Tuesday, Dalung said sports festival was important to sports development in states.

yoruba_text: Ó ní Ọriĺẹ̀-èdè yìí ti gbaradì fún eré Ìdá rayá ẹlẹ́ẹ̀kẹrìndínlógún irú rẹ̀ tí wọ́n sì ti pèsè à yè sí ílu Benin city, Asaba à tiUyo.
english_text: Nigeria has put forward the cities, Benin City, Asaba, Uyofor hosting the sixteen nations final.
